comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: I did not see the whole post because you deleted it, you should have read the other threads about asking for a loan if you're a newbie you should have collateral and based on your comment you do have coins as collateral.Â Your quote and I quoteQuoteOkay, I'll ask one of the members. I don't want to lose it but since I need the money I decided to take a loan instead.If you believe you have a profitable and good business plan then use your own fund, funding, and trusting a project should start with the developer.You should only take a loan if you do not have available funds to start your project.It's hard to get a fund if you only have your Twitter you have to introduce yourself professionally and include your Linkedin account where they can see your whole resume and your achievement and what guarantees you can present to your investors that their investments are safe and profitable.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: I think you should lock this thread and start a new one with all the information that you can and need to provide and as much as possible do not delete any post here and accept criticism, potential clients and investors would like to see how transparent and how honest you are in asking funds to your project.If you can find angel investors in your area, the better, try to come up with a working model and business plan, and it's better to ask for additional funding and not just full funding for a project that still doesn't exist.
